intro: Tragia hoffmanniae, commonly known as Hoffmann's tragia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
